item.title: firearms
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
We as the great people of the America of the States of glorious United America have a constitutional fundamental continental right to sue and shoot weapons and we as the great and free country of our proud country of eagles will fight to keep our eagles and our rights to shoot guns with our freedom and eagles.

Oh, say can you see by the dawn’s early light
What so proudly we hailed at the twilight’s last gleaming?
Whose broad stripes and bright stars thru the perilous fight,
O’er the ramparts we watched were so gallantly streaming?
And the rocket’s red glare, the bombs bursting in air,
Gave proof through the night that our flag was still there.
Oh, say does that star-spangled banner yet wave
O’er the land of the free and the home of the brave?

On the shore, dimly seen through the mists of the deep,
Where the foe’s haughty host in dread silence reposes,
What is that which the breeze, o’er the towering steep,
As it fitfully blows, half conceals, half discloses?
Now it catches the gleam of the morning’s first beam,
In full glory reflected now shines in the stream:
'Tis the star-spangled banner! Oh long may it wave
O’er the land of the free and the home of the brave!

And where is that band who so vauntingly swore
That the havoc of war and the battle’s confusion,
A home and a country should leave us no more!
Their blood has washed out their foul footsteps’ pollution.
No refuge could save the hireling and slave
From the terror of flight, or the gloom of the grave:
And the star-spangled banner in triumph doth wave
O’er the land of the free and the home of the brave!

Oh! thus be it ever, when freemen shall stand
Between their loved home and the war’s desolation!
Blest with victory and peace, may the heav’n rescued land
Praise the Power that hath made and preserved us a nation.
Then conquer we must, when our cause it is just,
And this be our motto: “In God is our trust.”
And the star-spangled banner in triumph shall wave
O’er the land of the free and the home of the brave!

America[/SIZE]

Read full topic

item.title: firearms
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
Idi:

shoot a cop

Malcolmjean:

Should firearms be allowed for daily use? What are the advantages and disadvantages?

That is just wrong, and I hope no one ever listens to this…

Jack Freeman:

I don’t think this help forum is dedicated to people with… ehm… problems like yours.

Firearms don’t have a daily use unless you live in one hellish battle-torn war zone.

For normal people in peaceful, but still crime infested areas, a firearm can get them into more trouble than it would save people, as most people don’t train properly with their firearms, and wouldn’t have the where-with-all to draw and fire their weapon properly in a fight-or-flight situation. More than likely their gun will be found in the pocket/purse when the event is over, or worst case scenario, used against them by their assailant.

Sad truth about gun ownership is that most people probably shouldn’t own them, and if they do buy them, should keep them at home. I’m not saying they should be illegal or anything, but I don’t think idiots should buy them, and most people are idiots.

Read full topic
